stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements gives the multiplicity of the zero at  C  with correct reasoning?

features.html:
• Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale. Moving from left to right:
    • The curve enters the window in the third quadrant.
    • The curve increases, intersecting the negative x axis at point A and reaching a relative maximum in the second quadrant.
    • The curve decreases from its relative maximum, passes through the y axis, and intersects the positive x axis at point B.
    • The curve decreases from point B and reaches a relative minimum in the fourth quadrant before increasing to a relative maximum at point C on the positive x axis.
    • The curve decreases from point C and exits the window in the bottom right of the fourth quadrant.

The figure shows the graph of a quartic polynomial function with zeros at A, B, and  C .

choicesHtml: 1, because the graph of the function intersects the x-axis once at C.
1, because the quartic polynomial function has four zeros: exactly one at A, one at B, one at C, and a non-real zero.
2, because the quartic polynomial function has three real zeros, one of which must have a multiplicity of 2, and the polynomial does not change signs at C.
2, because C is the second zero to the right of the origin, and there are more zeros to the right than to the left of the origin.
